page.title: 01Gazeteer.
page.content: {This attractive area}lies South of Newbury forming part of the{River {Enborne's}valley.Woods, fields and streams intermingle with spacious houses throughout much of the area, although on section is almost completely built up.This is{Wash {Common,}at the south western extremity of Newbury,where older street names such as{Battery End}commemorate the Civil War battle fought there.Two main roads pass though the area,busy with traffic,especially at holiday times. The numerous lorries emphasise Newbury's position on the route from the{Midlands to the Channel ports.}A former railway line is the proposed route for a necessary by-pass. Amenities include several types of schools,elegant Sandleford Priory among them,churches,garages,and a small sewage works.
